text: {| |} The SS Princess Maud was a single screw passenger/cargo steamship built in 1902 for the London and North Western Railway. She was torpedoed and sunk in the North Sea about north east by north from Blyth, Northumberland on 10 June 1918 by a German submarine variously quoted to be UB-88 or UB-34. ==References== Category:1902 ships Category:Ships built on the River Clyde Category:Passenger ships of the United Kingdom Category:Ships of the London and North Western Railway Category:Ships sunk by German submarines in World War I
title: SS Princess Maud (1902)
